title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Eastern and Uva provinces and in Polonnaruwa, Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Hambantota districts.

title: 16 dead, 16 missing as fire crews try to corral Los Angeles blazes before winds return this week
byline: Firefighters scrambled Sunday to make further progress against wildfires that have destroyed thousands of homes and killed 16 people in the Los Angeles area as forecasters again warned of dangerous weather with the return of strong winds this week.

title: Shooting incident targets businessman in Devinuwara
byline: Two unidentified gunmen opened fire in front of the house of a dry fish merchant at Thalpawila, Devinuwara, targeting the businessman.

title: Govt. plans to establish labs for medicine testing: Health Secretary
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Health, Dr. Anil Jasinghe, has announced that the government is focusing on the establishment of several laboratories to test medicines in the near future.

title: Fantasy Nail Art Fashion Show held in Sri Lanka
byline: The Fantasy Nail Art Fashion Show 2025 kicked off on Sunday in Sri Lanka’s capital, Colombo.

title: Schoolgirl abducted in Kandy found in Ampara, suspect arrested
byline: Police have located the schoolgirl abducted in Daulagala, Kandy on Saturday (11).

title: Sri Lanka’s first all-female staffed tourist hotel opens in Dambulla
byline: A groundbreaking milestone in South Asia’s tourism industry was achieved on January 10th with the grand opening of “Amba Yaalu”, the island nation’s first 100% female-staffed tourist hotel.

title: President Dissanayake to leave for China today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is set to depart the country this evening (13) for a four-day state visit to the People’s Republic of China.

title: Thailand’s cabinet approves draft law to legalise casinos and gambling
byline: Thailand’s cabinet has approved a draft law that would legalise gambling and casinos, a move aimed at boosting tourism, jobs and investment, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra said on Monday.

title: Schoolgirl abduction in Kandy: Suspect details motive to police
byline: Police today successfully apprehended Mohammed Nassar, a 31-year-old resident of Kahatapitiya in Gampola, who abducted an 18-year-old schoolgirl at Daulagala, Kandy, on January 11.

title: Health Minister inspects SPC for operational improvements
byline: The Minister of Health and Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, has vowed to safeguard all employees dedicated to resolving and correcting issues within the pharmaceutical sector.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected tomorrow
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that fairly heavy showers above 75mm can be expected at some places in Eastern, Uva and North-central provinces and in Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Hambantota districts tomorrow (14).

title: Teachers and principals will soon be among top 10 highest-paid positions: Deputy Minister
byline: The government is taking significant steps to address salary disparities in the education sector and elevate five key education services, including teachers and principals, to be among the 10 highest-paid professions in the country, Deputy Minister of Labour Mahinda Jayasinghe said.

title: Tsunami warnings issued as strong earthquake rattles southwestern Japan
byline: A strong earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.9 has hit southwestern Japan, the country’s Meteorological Agency said Monday.
